answerText: HIV [or Human Immunodeficiency Virus][10] People with AIDS often suffer from opportunistic infections caused by this set of organisms, which includes Pneumocystis jiroveci and Aspergillus niger. Echinocandins and amphotericin B are often used to treat infections caused by them.
heading: NASAT |2014 | 3 | 10 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question: This virus can infect dendritic cells via the DC-SIGN receptor, and also uses CCR5 to infect another cell type. [10] Name this virus, whose integrase enzyme is inhibited by Isentress. This virus infects and destroys helper T-cells, which in turn causes AIDS.
